Egypt, added the statement, recognized and appreciated the care accorded by Germany to the painted limestone bust of the famous ancient Egyptian queen, but added: Egypt is confident that the German authorities will assist in facilitating its return. The government and people of Egypt are eager that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. If returned, Zahi Hawass said, the bust will be exhibited at a new museum south of Cairo.

Donald Rumsfeld remains largely unapologetic about his overall handling of the Iraq conflict and concludes that the war has been worth the costs. , taking over day-to-day operations as CEO as of April 4. The company said the goal of the surprise executive change, the biggest at the Web firm since Eric Schmidt joined it as CEO in 2001, is to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Co-founder Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects, in particular new products, one of his key passions, as he said on a conference calls. 4. Mr Eric Schmidt will become executive chairman of the company, focusing externally on partnerships and government outreach. Moments after Google announced the change, Mr Eric Schmidt sent a message to his Twitter followers saying, Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!
